jbt.execution.task.composite
Class ExecutionStaticPriorityList

java.lang.Object
  jbt.execution.core.ExecutionTask
      jbt.execution.task.composite.ExecutionComposite
          jbt.execution.task.composite.ExecutionStaticPriorityList
All Implemented Interfaces:
ITaskListener
public class ExecutionStaticPriorityList
extends ExecutionComposite

ExecutionStaticPriorityList is the ExecutionTask that knows how to run a ModelStaticPriorityList.

Author:
Ricardo Juan Palma Dur√°n

activeChild

private ExecutionTask activeChild
Currently active child.

guardsExecutors

private java.util.List<BTExecutor> guardsExecutors
List containing the IBTExecutors in charge of running the guards. The i-th element of this list manages the guard of the i-th child ( children). Note that if a guard is null, its corresponding IBTExecutor is also null.

guardsResults

private java.util.List<ExecutionTask.Status> guardsResults
This List contains the current evaluation status of all the guards. If a guard is null, its corresponding status is ExecutionTask.Status.SUCCESS (null guards are evaluated to true).

Constructor Detail

ExecutionStaticPriorityList

public ExecutionStaticPriorityList(ModelTask modelTask,
                                   BTExecutor executor,
                                   ExecutionTask parent)
Creates an ExecutionStaticPriorityList that is able to run a ModelStaticPriorityList task and that is managed by a BTExecutor.

Parameters:
modelTask - the ModelStaticPriorityList that this ExecutionStaticPriorityList is going to run.
executor - the BTExecutor in charge of running this ExecutionStaticPriorityList.
parent - the parent ExecutionTask of this task.
Method Detail

internalSpawn

protected void internalSpawn()
Spawns the first child with active guard. If there is no active guard, the spawning process is considered to have failed, so internalTick() will return ExecutionTask.Status.FAILURE. If some guards are still running the spawning process is not considered to have started yet.

Specified by:
internalSpawn in class ExecutionTask
See Also:
ExecutionTask.internalSpawn()

internalTick

protected ExecutionTask.Status internalTick()
If the spawning process has not finished yet (because there are some guards running), then this method keeps evaluating the guards, and returns ExecutionTask.Status.RUNNING. Whenever there is an active child (because the spawning process has finished), its status is returned.

If the spawning process failed, this method just returns ExecutionTask.Status.FAILURE.

Specified by:
internalTick in class ExecutionTask
Returns:
the status of the task after being ticked.
See Also:
ExecutionTask.internalTick()

internalTerminate

protected void internalTerminate()
Just terminates the currently active child (if there is one).

Specified by:
internalTerminate in class ExecutionTask
See Also:
ExecutionTask.internalTerminate()

resetGuardsEvaluation

private void resetGuardsEvaluation()
Resets the evaluation of all the guards. This method leaves all the guard executors (guardsExecutors) ready to start again the evaluation of the guards. It internally terminates the IBTExecutor of each guard, creates a new one, and then ticks it.

evaluateGuards

private Pair<ExecutionTask.Status,java.lang.Integer> evaluateGuards()
Evaluate all the guards that have not finished yet, that is, those whose result in guardsResults is ExecutionTask.Status.RUNNING, by ticking them.

If all the guards have finished in failure, this method returns a Pair whose first element is ExecutionTask.Status.FAILURE. If there is at least one guard still being evaluated, the first element of the Pair contains ExecutionTask.Status.RUNNING. If all the guards have been evaluated and at least one has succeeded, the first element of the Pair is ExecutionTask.Status.SUCCESS, and the second one is the index, over the list of guards (guardsExecutors) , of the first guard (that with the highest priority) that has succeeded.

storeTerminationState

protected ITaskState storeTerminationState()
Does nothing.

Specified by:
storeTerminationState in class ExecutionTask
Returns:
an ITaskState object with the persistent state information of the task, for future use. The returned ITaskState must be readable by restoreState().
See Also:
ExecutionTask.storeTerminationState()
